byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and SUSANNE CRAIG

abstract: Upcoming federal trials of former New York State Assemblyman Sheldon Silver and former State Sen Dean G Skelos are expected to put culture of Albany under microscope; men were, as former speaker and majority leader, respectively, two of most powerful men in state politics, and court papers suggest that trials will not only focus on charges of corruption, bribery and nepotism but will also offer granular detail about political culture prevalent in state.
lead_paragraph: The coming trials of Sheldon Silver and Dean G. Skelos will focus attention on the crisis of corruption in the state capital.

headline.main: In Two Corruption Cases, the Culture of Albany Will Go on Trial
headline.print_headline: Albany Culture Is Put on Trial in Graft Cases

snippet: The coming trials of Sheldon Silver and Dean G. Skelos will focus attention on the crisis of corruption in the state capital.
